categories_notes: PRNG: Alabama Admin Code 220-2-.92; not specific to imperiled species protection, just game laws
Endangered (just five species)
HR, HS, SR, or SA for plants (FE and FT included), animals that are listed as '1a' under SGCN column or FE or FT are categorized as 'endangered'

endangered and threatened are protected from take, import, transport, sell, purchase, and possession.  The definition of 'endangered' includes endangered and threatened species listed (or canidates) by the ESA, and any native species listed as endangered by the Commission

Endangered and Threatened (both plants and animals) under the CESA, but the Native Plant protection act also says categories protected from take are "endangered and rare". The admin code declares that any species designated as 'rare' on or before 1985 is a 'threatened' species
State Endangered, State Threatened, no plant law
State or Federally Endangered, State or Federally Threatened
Endangered (which also says E and T ESA are adopted by endangered list, says candidate species may be considered, but not automatically included)

Federally endangered and threatened and State threatened. Had an SSC list but now getting rid of it (as of 2010), so now only 1 species left on list. Plants law protected E and Commercially exploited, and T with less strict protection
Endangered, Threatened, Rare, Unusual --> for both plants and animals
Federally endangered and federally threatened;  and any other species the department deems of threatened or endangered status

Endangered or threatened, no plants. Idaho code only discusses plans for conserving ESA species once they are delisted, but admin code states listing of endangered and threatened species in the state (separate of the ESA), and only specific to wildlife (no plants)
Endangered, Threatened. They also automatically include/ protect anything listed under the US ESA.
Animals (SE, FE, FT)
Threatened, Endangered. ESA species not included in definition but included in the prohibitions clause
Threatened, Endangered
Endangered and federally endangered
Endangered, Threatened plants and animals
endangered and threatened, separate laws for wildlife and marine species
endangered, threatened, species of greatest concern (less protection for SGC, but still illegal to remove from the wild)
Endangered, Threatened, SC
Protects Threatened, Endagnered, and also includes extirpated species that would be protected if found again in the state so they are included in the list
Threatened and Endangered
Endangered, no plants
Endangered, federally listed endangerd or threatened

Endangered, does not protect plants, does not mention ESA species in definition but says the department may consider Esa species, and if an ESA species becomes delisted and is also on the state list the department will consider delisting.
Animals & Plants (SE, FE, ST, FT)
protected, endangered, threatened and sensistive. Protected animals can further be classified as e, t, or s (revised statutes)
Animals & Plants (SE, FE, ST, FT)
Endangered
Endangered, and US ESA endangered,  state Threatened listed, but not from "take", but ESA threatened are protected from take. Plant law only defined endangered plants, which includes esa species
Plants: endangered, threatened, rare, vulnerable. Animals: endangered, threatened, special concern
Animals: Endangered, threatend, special concern, Plants: endangered, threatened, special concern

No official legislative framework. Abide by ESA rules. Fischman et al. states they do have protection laws (but for SWAP federal money). They do have species of special concern that have special funds for conservation (level 1 and 2) but it is federal money. There are no independent state legislative protective provisions
animals: endangered, plants: E and T
No plants, state endangered and state threatened, fed endangered , fed threatened
Endangered, Threatened

Threatened, Endangered, Pennsylvania Threatened, Pennsylvania Endangered; Plants are protected under separate law . They protect anything listed federally as threatened or endangered and anything listed in the state as threatened or endangered
Animals & Plants (SE, FE)
Animals state endangered and federally endangered
Animals & Plants (SE, ST)
Plants (endangered (includes FE in definition)); Animals (E, T, INOM; also adopts ESA list of tennessee species)
Animals: endangered, threatened, and federally endangered. Plants: Endangered and Threatened (ESA not automatically included)
just abide by ESA, define endangered and threatened as ESA endangered and threatened, but do not have a separate state law to protect imperiled species
Animals & Plants (SE, FE, ST, FT)
Endangered and Threatened Species / separate plant and insect law protects threatened and endangered

Endangered (no plants). Laws describe threatened and sensitive species, but protection laws are just related to game laws (i.e., the only rule is that you can't hunt them. Protection is not related to conserving the species).
None
Animals & Plants (SE, FE, ST, FT)
None
